2.text: Peel off the papery layer of the garlic, leaving the skin intact.

3.text: Cut about 1⁄4 in (0.64 cm) off the top of the head.

4.text: Set the head on a piece of aluminum foil that’s big enough to cover it.

5.text: Drizzle 1 to 2 teaspoons (4.9 to 9.9 ml) of olive oil over the top of the head.

6.text: Wrap the head in aluminum foil.

7.text: Place the wrapped head in the oven to roast for 40 minutes.

8.text: Check to see if the garlic is soft by poking it with a knife.

9.text: Remove the garlic from the oven and let it cool for 5 minutes.

10.text: Place 6 tablespoons (89 ml) of olive oil and 25 to 30 garlic cloves in a skillet.

11.text: Heat the skillet over medium heat until the oil starts to sizzle.

12.text: Reduce the heat to low and let the garlic cook for 20 to 30 minutes.

13.text: Remove the cloves from the oil and let them cool before eating.
